TASK: Create SvelteKit API endpoints for beads issue management.

CONTEXT:
- Working directory: /Users/jurrejan/Documents/development/_management/beads-kanban
- This is a SvelteKit 5 project with Svelte 5 (runes)
- Beads issues are managed via CLI: `bd list --json`, `bd update <id> --status <status>`
- Status values: open, in_progress, blocked, closed

CREATE these files:
1. src/routes/api/issues/+server.ts - GET all issues (run bd list --json)
2. src/routes/api/issues/[id]/+server.ts - PATCH to

TASK: Create a Kanban board UI component in SvelteKit 5 with Svelte 5 runes.

CONTEXT:
- Working directory: /Users/jurrejan/Documents/development/_management/beads-kanban
- SvelteKit 5 + Svelte 5 (use $state, $effect, not stores)
- Issues have: id, title, description, status (open|in_progress|blocked|closed), priority (1-4), issue_type
- API endpoint: GET /api/issues returns {issues: [...]}
- API endpoint: PATCH /api/issues/[id] with body {status: "new_status"}

CREATE/UPDATE:
1. src/routes/+pag
BEAD_DONE: API endpoints created - GET /api/issues and PATCH /api/issues/[id]
BEAD_DONE: Kanban UI created - 160 lines, 4 columns with drag-drop, 5s polling, Svelte 5 runes

Add column card counts
description: Display the number of cards in each column header (e.g. 'Open (3)'). Helps users quickly see workload distribution across statuses.

title: Add search/filter functionality
description: Add a search bar to filter issues by title or description. Also add filter dropdowns for priority and type. Essential for boards with many issues.

title: Persist column collapse state
description: Allow users to collapse/expand columns and remember the state in localStorage. Useful for focusing on specific workflow stages.

title: Add keyboard shortcuts
description: Keyboard navigation: arrow keys to move between cards, Enter to edit, Delete to remove, N for new issue. Improves power user productivity.

title: Show issue dependencies
description: Beads supports issue dependencies. Show blocked-by indicators on cards and prevent moving blocked issues to closed. Visual dependency lines would be nice-to-have.

title: Add due dates support
description: Display due dates on cards if set in beads. Highlight overdue items in red. Sort by due date option within columns.

title: Mobile responsive layout
description: Current CSS assumes desktop. Add media queries for mobile: stack columns vertically, larger touch targets, swipe gestures for column navigation.

title: Dark mode theme
description: Add a dark mode toggle in header. Store preference in localStorage. Use CSS custom properties for easy theming.

[Dialog] Q: I see you have a basic wsStore.svelte.ts that handles incoming events (init, pane_added, message, delta, status). The daemon protocol supports these commands:

• panes - List panes
• status - Get pane status  
• add - Add pane
• send - Send message to pane
• get - Get pane output
• rm - Remove pane

What WebSocket command functionality do you want to implement?
A: Full command suite (all 6 commands)

[Dialog] Q: For the command response handling, how should we handle async responses from the daemon?
A: Fire-and-forget (rely on broadcast events)

[Dialog] Q: Commands added to wsStore. Want me to also add UI controls in the pane activity sidebar (add/remove pane buttons, message input)?
A: Yes, add UI

    "error": "Error: unknown flag: --type
Usage:
  bd update [id...] [flags]

Flags:
      --acceptance string      Acceptance criteria
      --add-label strings      Add labels (repeatable)
  -a, --assignee string        Assignee
  -d, --description string     Issue description
      --design string          Design notes
      --external-ref string    External reference (e.g., 'gh-9', 'jira-ABC')
  -h, --help                   help for update
      --json                   Output JSON format
      --notes string           Additional notes
  -p, --priority string        Priority (0-4 or P0-P4, 0=highest)
      --remove-label strings   Remove labels (repeatable)
      --set-labels strings     Set labels, replacing all existing (repeatable)
  -s, --status string          New status
      --title string           New title

Global Flags:
      --actor string     Actor name for audit trail (default:  or jurrejan)
      --allow-stale      Allow operations on potentially stale data (skip staleness check)
      --db string        Database path (default: auto-discover .beads/*.db)
      --no-auto-flush    Disable automatic JSONL sync after CRUD operations
      --no-auto-import   Disable automatic JSONL import when newer than DB
      --no-daemon        Force direct storage mode, bypass daemon if running
      --no-db            Use no-db mode: load from JSONL, no SQLite
      --profile          Generate CPU profile for performance analysis
  -q, --quiet            Suppress non-essential output (errors only)
      --sandbox          Sandbox mode: disables daemon and auto-sync
  -v, --verbose          Enable verbose/debug output

"

View or add comments to a beads issue.

## View Comments

To view all comments on an issue:
- $1: Issue ID (e.g., bd-123)

Use the beads CLI `bd comments <issue-id>` to list all comments. Show them to the user with timestamps and authors.

## Add Comment

To add a comment:
- $1: "add"
- $2: Issue ID
- $3: Comment text (or use -f flag for file input)

Use `bd comments add <issue-id> "comment text"` to add a comment. Confirm the comment was added successfully.

Comments are useful for:
- Progress

Initialize beads issue tracking in the current directory.

If a prefix is provided as $1, use it as the issue prefix (e.g., "myproject" creates issues like myproject-1, myproject-2). If not provided, the default is the current directory name.

After initialization:

[Dialog] Q: The ticket says "Feedback in comment" but I don't see a comment. What's the feedback for the teleport transition?
A: fetch the comment

View or add comments to a beads issue.

## View Comments

To view all comments on an issue:
- $1: Issue ID (e.g., bd-123)

Use the beads CLI `bd comments <issue-id>` to list all comments. Show them to the user with timestamps and authors.

## Add Comment

To add a comment:
- $1: "add"
- $2: Issue ID
- $3: Comment text (or use -f flag for file input)

Use `bd comments add <issue-id> "comment text"` to add a comment. Confirm the comment was added successfully.

Comments are useful for:
- Progress

title: Improve the macOS Safari compatibility. Update.
description:
Did you try this method? 

For Your Own Websites (Developer Method)
This is how web developers control the color for their sites in Safari:
Add a Meta Tag: In your website's <head> section, add a <meta name="theme-color"> tag.
Set a Color: Use a hex code or color name (e.g., #FF5733 or tomato).
html
<meta name="theme-color" content="#FF5733">
Support Light/Dark Mode: Add separate tags for light and dark modes for better responsiveness.
html
<meta name="theme-color" content="#FF5733" media="(prefers-color-scheme: light)">
<meta name="theme-color" content="#3333FF" media="(prefers-color-scheme: dark)">
 
This video shows how developers can use a theme-color meta tag to change the address bar color:
Related video thumbnail
57s


The Mac Observer
YouTube • 24 Sept 2021
For General Browsing (User Settings)
You can adjust how Safari's tab bar looks based on your system: 
Open Preferences: In Safari, go to Safari > Settings (or Preferences on older macOS).
Go to Tabs: Click the Tabs section.
Choose Layout: Select the Compact tab layout.
Enable Color: Go to Safari > Settings > Advanced, and check "Show color in compact tab bar" (or similar option) to let it tint with website colors. 
This video demonstrates how to change the tab layout in Safari:
Related video thumbnail
57s


TheTechGuy600
YouTube • 26 Mar 2015
Using Safari Profiles (for different contexts)
Create a Profile: Go to Safari > Settings > Profiles, click the '+' to add one, and choose a color/icon.
Open New Window: Open a new Safari window for that profile (File > New Window with Profile).
Color Indication: The active profile's color might appear in the toolbar or sidebar, giving a visual cue for your browsing context, though it's a subtle feature. 
This video explains how to set up and use Safari profiles:
Related video thumbnail
49s



MC Media

title: Fix Svelte Warnings
description:
The Svelte compiler emits 24+ accessibility and CSS warnings when the dev server starts. These should be fixed to ensure the app is accessible and CSS is clean.

Key warnings:
- Interactive elements (menu, div with onclick) need tabindex and keyboard handlers
- Labels not associated with form controls
- Unused CSS selectors (~15 unused selectors in style block)
- Non-interactive elements with drag handlers need ARIA roles

title: Improve card hotkey ui
description: The card hotkey UI overlay is overlapping elements and showing too much information. Current implementation shows all available keyboard shortcuts in an overlay that's cluttering the interface. The request is to simplify this - NOT to implement Vim keybindings (explicitly noted as "dont do vim").

title: Add attachments functionality
description:
Enable users to attach files (documents, images, screenshots, etc.) to issues. Attachments should be stored with the issue and be retrievable through the issue detail pane.

Current state: No attachment support exists. The Issue interface has no attachment field, and the Beads CLI may or may not support attachments natively.

title: Make the New Issue button part of the left side or
description:
The "New Issue" button is currently floating in a separate location (top-right or bottom). It should be integrated into the left side of the UI or made part of the first column (Backlog) to feel more like part of the board layout.

Note: Use the frontend-design skill when working on this to ensure high design quality.
